channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pile of wooden boards flytipped on Friary Road, 9th January
item.description:
Please come and pick up all this wood. it's created quite a mess. All needs to go. Outside the old record shop. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 100, Friary Road, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large road dip / sunken road on Chapel Road, outside house no 32, 9th January
item.description:
There is a significant dip or sunken section in the road surface. When buses and other heavy vehicles drive over it, it causes strong vibrations that can be felt inside the house and is shaking the property. This happens repeatedly throughout the day and is causing ongoing disturbance and concern about potential structural damage. The defect appears to be getting worse and needs inspection and repair.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chapel Road, Barnehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Paving slab lifted, 9th January
item.description:
This paving slab has been lifted due to vehicle impact and the strange lack of a raised road kerb. For some reason the housing development here didn't install a road kerb. Lambeth please copy in your highways team to address this please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dalton Street, West Norwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Harland Road grass verge being damaged by lorries., 9th January
item.description:
Grass verge is being eroded ,damaged by lorries, ploughing the grass verge when driving down harland, lots of mud and debris on road, since works began at 55 Little Birches Sidcup. 4 days ago work started.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 43, Harland Avenue, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London

item.title: Free parking suspended by builder, 9th January
item.description:
Parking has been removed by builder as he is building in garden of 55 Little Birches. This is not fair or legal. Please attend and rectify. Its been 3 days now since parking bay has been taken out of action.Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 52, Little Birches, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Red tagged graffiti, 9th January
item.description:
Two instances of large red tagging graffiti on the wall on the property on the corner of station Road junction. Worst is on the area above the street sign for Lower station road on the corner.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lower Station Road, Crayford, Greater London

item.title: Fly tipped trash, 9th January
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lee Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Lamppost cover, 9th January
item.description:

item.title: Sink whole in road, 9th January
item.description:
Thw sinkhole has been there for more than 24 hours without and traffic management there are currently barriers but no parking restrictions either this is creating dangerous road conditions.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Homesdale Road, Widmore, Greater London

item.title: Flytipping, 9th January
item.description:
Constan flytipping, made worse by the bin men leaving bags on the floor after collection of waste, no road sweepers too clean up after them.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 77, Chichester Road, Edmonton, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes, 9th January
item.description:
There are several large and dangerous potholes on Dunvegan Road. They began as small cracks but have grown significantly, and some are now deep enough to cause serious damage to vehicles. Compared with nearby roads such as Greenvale and Well Hall Parade, Dunvegan Road is in extremely poor condition. It’s also clear that multiple repair attempts have already been made, but the problems keep returning. A full resurfacing may be a more cost‑effective and long‑term solution
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dunvegan Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large depression on tarmac path, 9th January
item.description:
There is a large depression appx. 2 foot across on the tarmac path. It restricts the width of the path and is trip hazard. It is difficult to navigate around (currently filled with water) by walkers, runners and cyclists. It is outside the Bromley Bike shed. Has been there for many months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hook Farm Road, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
